subject: Season Six Premiere
event:
GAME OF THRONES had its gala season six premiere last week in Hollywood, at the historic and glorious Grauman's Chinese Theatre.  

The rest of the world will have to wait until April 24 to see the first episode.

But here's the latest trailer from HBO:

<lj-embed id="716"/>

comments.article: So, George, how many episodes you wrote for this season yourself?
None.  Just working on the book.  Writing an episode would have meant taking at least a month off, maybe longer.
comments.subject: Re: .

comments.article:
This season will be fantastic by the looks of the trailers.

Can't wait!
It can't come fast enough, it's going to be action packed. Thank you for sharing this amazing world with us. <3 Best always, Ser Martin.
Can't wait for this. Better be good!
I drink and I know things

comments.article:
looks awesome, regardless of which books are out, and which ones aren't.

I look forward to comparing "After season 5 of the show" with "after book 5" of your series.

It looks great, doesn't it, George? Those guys do such a good job adapting this.

Congrats on the new season! None of this could've happened without you.

Not adding much here in my comment but I just wanted to throw a thanks out there for making this world we all love so much. Me and the wife are having trouble even waiting!

Hope life is good. Enjoy the season!

PS: An off topic aside... Absolutely cannot wait for you to interview Stephen King. You two are my favorites so that's gonna be big for me!

Thanks again,
Scotty

Mr. Martin, if you had to say how much percent of the series will be different from the upcoming book, what would that number be?

They're roughly 70% the same? 90% similar? Only 30% faithful one to another?

comments.upictitle: ryan, diesel, ty johnson, dirk vargas, ect.. ect..: Syd
comments.article: Looks pretty gnarly, looking forward to it. Fingers crossed to see the fat Lannister this season. Fingers crossed she'll make another appearance in Winds of Winter, as well!

Hey George, in your year-end post you said that WINDs is months away if the writing goes well. How's the writing been going since then? Sorry for bothering you about the book, you don't have to answer if you don't want to!

comments.article: I fear you have your answer mate.

comments.article:

comments.subject: Episodes

comments.article: I'm listening to the ASOIAF audio books on my long stakeout patrols and during slow shifts. Having already read the series,the World, and the D&E novellas, I've concluded that you're one outstanding fictional Nostradamus. The Ghost of High Heart has been spot on and geniusly written.  Here's to hoping Aegon is that paper blackfyre pretender dragon. Also may you live as, long as Maester Aemon and just maybe/hopefully think about producing  a Ser Barriston novel or Biopic.  "The Bold" or "A life of Chivalry"
How much money would it take for you to wear Mace's helmet and plumage to a con?
What, don't you like my greek sailor's cap?
comments.subject: RE: Episodes

comments.article: Oooh, the premiere. No grrm blog for 2 weeks makes the internet theories run rampant.
Is it true that Barack Obama got a screener of episode 1?
comments.subject: Barack Obama

comments.article: So I hear.
comments.subject: RE: Barack Obama

comments.article:
Looks like Riverrun will get besieged after all. I really hope they put in the Blackfish verbally kicking the crap out of Jaime.

On an unrelated note: I saw on winteriscoming.net that you'll be interviewing Stephen King in June. I suspect you've had enough experience with being interviewed yourself that you know what not to ask, such as questions that two seconds on Google could provide an answer for, but the news had me reflecting on my favorite interview I've seen with you. As I recall, it was one of the ones where you discussed Vietnam, your conscientious objector status during that war, and how it influenced your depiction of war. It wasn't just about the bare facts, but actually getting into how you think and why you write a certain way.

Basically, the interviews that always interest the most are the ones that dig into the person's way of thinking a bit. I'm hoping you'll do a bit of that, writer to writer, when you interview Stephen King. Regardless, it should be really fun to watch.
Hello, Mr. Martin! Is there a chance that you release a new sample chapter from TWOW before the 24th as you did before Season 4 and Season 5?
comments.subject: New chapter?

comments.article:
Have you already seen the episode, George?
If yes, how did you like it?
Have not seen anything yet
George,do you think book 6 will come over this year?We are looking forward to your amazing book!
I have given up making predictions.

I was just wondering if Robb Stark ever fostered anywhere and if not, why? at first i thought it was more of a southern thing but then remembered Ned and Domeric bolton fostered, so there's at least some precedent for northmen doing it. best guess as to why not, Robb would have wanted to take Theon and/or Jon with him and Ned could not allow that.
comments.subject: random question

comments.article:
I was not going to watch season 6 until I have read the book. But why not enjoy the series and treat it as a fan fiction that might get somethings right.
I just wonder if Mr Martin can get influenced in his writing by what he will see in this season or write something differently just to avoid identical similarities with the tv series.
I must be very interesting to watch this season for Mr Martin and see where writers went with his plot without book source.
Problem with that, is hopefully there is a lot of writing already done on Winds of Winter. If Mr. Martin starts going back and changing things based off the show, we will never get the book!
That is so wonderful! "That's what I do: I drink and I know things."
It looks awesome; can't wait!!
